com.jasonlafrance.wtbbackend.vehicle

Class Drone

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.lang.Thread
      • com.jasonlafrance.wtbbackend.vehicle.Drone
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Runnable

    public final class Drone
extends java.lang.Thread
    Drone class for vehicle tracking testing. Drones mimic vehicles based on supplied GTFS routing and scheduling. The drones also only interact with the backend server via the GPS input portal, so as far as the server knows, these are real vehicles.
    Author:
    Jason LaFrance

    • Constructor Detail

      • Drone

        public Drone(int inID,
             RoutePath inRoute,
             double startSpeed,
             double inPushWait,
             java.lang.String inServer,
             java.lang.String inPassword,
             boolean randomStart)
        Create a Drone object from given data
        Parameters:
        inID - The Drone's ID for tracking
        inRoute - The Drone's route
        startSpeed - The Drone's steady speed
        inPushWait - The time between GPS beacons
        inServer - The backend server URL
        inPassword - The backend server password
        randomStart - If the Drone should start randomly instead of as scheduled (DEBUGGING)
